result.execSummary:
The defendant Deangelo W Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.  Eligible for CIP and SAP.
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  AMENDED 10-25-2022:  Court ordered financial obligations amended to include attorney fees.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  No contact with T.T. unless approved by Family Court and the agent.  Anger management.  Parenting counseling.  Domestic abuse counseling.  Comply with any Family Court orders or child support orders.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

Does not plan to seek postconviction relief.

11:31 AM Defendant Deangelo W Jackson in court, in custody.  Attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon in court for Deangelo W Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  State is in victim witness compliance.  Upon plea to Cts. 1 and 2 in case 22CF1053 and a plea to Ct. 2 in 21CF1842, the State would recommend 18 mo. IC and 18 mo. ES, i/s, 2 yr probation on 22CF1053 and a fine on case 21CF1842.  Court performs plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters his plea. Parties make sentencing arguments.  Defendant speaks on his own behalf. 

Plea:
22CF1053:
Ct. 1- NC
Ct. 2- NC
21CF1842:
Ct. 2- NC

BTC:
21CF1904: DRI
22CF1053:
Ct. 1- GUILTY, 3 yr. WPS, 1 1/2 yr. IC and 1 1/2 yr. ES, i/s, 2 yr. probation.  Eligible for CIP and SAP if revoked. 
Ct. 2- GUILTY, 3 yr. WPS, 1 1/2 yr. IC and 1 1/2 yr. ES, i/s, 2 yr. probation.  Eligible for CIP and SAP if revoked. 
21CF1842:
Ct. 1- DRI
Ct. 2- GUILTY, $300 fine, Court costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge, Domestic Abuse Surcharge.  Payment plan of $50/month beginning on December 1, 2022.

Conditions:
No contact with T.T. unless approved by Family court and the agent. 
No alcohol or controlled substances to be monitored by random UA's/breathalyzers.  AODA assessment and any follow through with any recommendations from agent. 
Anger management. 
Parenting counseling.
Domestic abuse counseling.
Obtain and maintain full time employment. 
Comply with any Family Court orders and child support. 
Court Costs.
$100 Mandatory Domestic Abuse Surcharge.
DNA Sample and surcharge.
FAW/Vote.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim T.T. (person, property, residence or family). Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

2:10 PM Defendant Deangelo W Jackson in court.  Attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon in court for Deangelo W Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. BTC: Atty McClendon county appointed on this case at the same repayment.
